whatItDoes: Lightweight wearable device worn on upper back/shoulders. Vibrates gently when posture slouches, training correct alignment. Drug-free, discreet under clothing. Targets desk workers and WFH women with chronic back/neck/shoulder pain.
notes: MONSTER growth signal — uprightpose.com went from 92K (Nov) → 161K (Dec) → 368K (Jan) visits. This is a 4× month-on-month surge. Search-dominant traffic (52%) = organic pull. Women 25-45 at desk jobs are prime. Easy to angle: WFH pain, forward-head posture, mum back pain. No health claim compliance risk. COGS is very low. Simple product to understand.
mutualDropshipping: TBC — search 'posture corrector wearable' on Mutual

productName: Red Light LED Therapy Face Mask
whatItDoes: Flexible silicone face mask with red (630-660nm) and near-infrared (810-850nm) LEDs. Worn 10-20 min/day to stimulate collagen, reduce fine lines, clear acne, improve skin tone. FDA-cleared light therapy class.
notes: CurrentBody (major competitor) drives 755K monthly visits — massive validated market. Product is highly visual with clear transformation content. Multiple dropship-friendly alternatives exist at $79-129 retail vs CurrentBody's $380+. Strong 'dupe' angle. Women 25-45 who can't afford clinic visits. Excellent upsell potential with serums, eye masks, neck LED panels.

productName: Wireless TENS Period Pain Relief Device
whatItDoes: Small, discrete wearable TENS (Transcutaneous Electrical Nerve Stimulation) device that clips to the lower abdomen during menstruation. Delivers drug-free electrical pulses that interrupt pain signals and trigger endorphin release. Livia is the market leader at $149 — opportunity to offer equivalent at $49-69.
notes: Livia has 31K monthly visitors (passes 30K threshold). Pain is acute and urgent — highest impulse purchase driver. Drug-free angle is powerful (women avoiding ibuprofen). Discreet enough to use at work. HOWEVER: needs differentiation from Livia (branding, price, or features). Generic TENS devices have quality variance — sourcing is key. FB ads in this space use strong pain-point hooks. Check for FDA/CE marking requirements.

productName: Women's Detox + Gut Health Tea Blend

notes: SkinnyFit drives 193K monthly visits (19.5% from social = heavily paid social driven). Category is MASSIVE but requires private label setup — NOT direct dropship. Minimum order quantities, packaging, and supplement compliance (MHRA in UK, FDA in US) are real barriers. Strong subscription potential but upfront investment needed. Monitor category but deprioritise until THALYVE is scaling.
